hu.unideb.kgsoft.scrabble

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.unideb.kgsoft.scrabble.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends Object
    The Controller class represents the controller of the MVC pattern. Controls the data flow into model object and updates the view whenever data changes. It is the core of the application, controls the logic and the flow of the game. Handles all user interactions. A single Controller object exists at the same time.

    The Controller object contains references to objects of other classes that help to define the application logic and provide basic services. These classes are:

    • Dictionary: contains the list of the words that can be formed.
    • Gameboard: represent the game board on which the tiles are placed; can also check the validity of itself.
    • Bag: represents the bag from which tiles can be drawn.
    • Player: represents the human player.
    • Computer: represents the computer opponent.
    • GameState: informations about the game are transfered to the view classes through the object of this class.
    Author:
    gergo

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller(InputStream inputStream)
           throws FileNotFoundException
        Constructor for creating a Controller object. The file provided as parameter will be used to construct a Dictionary object. All fields are set to default values.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - the dictionary file containing a list of words
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the file couldn't be found

    • Method Detail

      • initNewGame

        public void initNewGame()
        Initializes a new game. This consists of setting the fields of the board and the scores to default values, replacing the bag with a filled one, then drawing letters for the player then for the computer.

      • handleMouseMotion

        public void handleMouseMotion(double mouseX,
                              double mouseY)
        This method is called when the user moves the mouse. Updates the view so that the tile in hand will follow the cursor.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - the x coordinate of the cursor in the game canvas
        mouseY - the y coordinate of the cursor in the game canvas

      • handleMousePressedOnBoard

        public void handleMousePressedOnBoard(int row,
                                      int col,
                                      double mouseX,
                                      double mouseY)
        Called when the user clicks on the game board. Row and column indices are provided as parameters. Mouse coordinates are needed to update the position of the tile in hand. A tile can be placed on the board or picked up from it. The legality of the board is checked and the played words, their correctness, the number of points obtainable are also determined, then requests a view update.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index of the cell on which the user clicked
        col - the column index of the cell on which the user clicked
        mouseX - the x coordinate of the mouse in the game canvas
        mouseY - the y coordinate of the mouse in the game canvas

      • handleMousePressedOnTray

        public void handleMousePressedOnTray(int index,
                                     double mouseX,
                                     double mouseY)
        Called when the user clicks on the tray. The index position on which the user clicked and the mouse coordinates are provided as parameters. Mouse coordinates are needed to update the position of the tile in hand. A tile can be placed on the tray or picked up from it. Requests a view update.
        Parameters:
        index - the index position at which the user clicked on the tray
        mouseX - the x coordinate of the mouse in the game canvas
        mouseY - the y coordinate of the mouse in the game canvas

      • computerReady

        public void computerReady()
        Called when the computer finished thinking, placed a word if could, and ends its turn by drawing new tiles from the bag and checking if the game ended. Requests a view update.

      • redrawTiles

        void redrawTiles(Tray tray)
        Draws new tiles from the bag instead of the current ones. The current tiles are put back into the bag. The tray on which the operation should be performed is provided as parameter.
        Parameters:
        tray - the Tray object on which the operation should be performed

      • drawTilesFromBag

        void drawTilesFromBag(Tray tray)
        Draws new tiles from the bag, to fill the tray. The tray on which the operation should be performed is provided as parameter.
        Parameters:
        tray - the Tray object on which the operation should be performed

      • handleDoneButton

        public void handleDoneButton()
        Called when the user wants to end his turn and clicks on the done button. Passes the turn to the computer and the computer thinking thread starts. Requests view update.

      • handlePassButton

        public void handlePassButton()
        Called when the user wants to pass his turn and clicks on the pass button. Checks game end. Starts computer thinking thread. Requests view update.

      • handleRedrawButton

        public void handleRedrawButton()
        Called when the user wants to draw new tiles instead of the current ones and clicks on the redraw button. Starts computer thinking thread. Requests view update.

      • checkGameEnd

        private void checkGameEnd()
        Checks if the game has ended. If the game ended, a message is shown.

      • updateGameView

        public void updateGameView()
        Updates the game view. Updates the appropriate methods of the view class to achieve this. The board and the tiles will be painted.

      • setupInitialView

        public void setupInitialView()
        Sets up the view so that it shows a "pre-game" state.

      • login

        public boolean login(String username,
                     String passwd)
        Tries to log in a user by calling the appropriate method of the DAO object. The user name and password are provided as parameters. If the database is unreachable or the user name and password are not correct, an error message is shown. Returns true on success.
        Parameters:
        username - the name of the user who wants to log in
        passwd - the password of the user
        Returns:
        true if the user successfully logged in, false otherwise

      • newUser

        public boolean newUser(String username,
                       String passwd,
                       String passwdAgain)
        Registers a new user by calling the appropriate method of the DAO object. The user name and password are provided as parameters. If the password and the retyped password are not the same, an error message is shown. An error message is shown also when the user name already exists in the database, or the database server is unreachable.
        Parameters:
        username - the user name to register
        passwd - the password of the new user
        passwdAgain - the retyped password
        Returns:
        true if the new user was registered successfully, false otherwise

      • startNewGame

        public void startNewGame()
        Called when a user wants to start a new game. A confirmation message is displayed, then a new game is initialized if the user confirms the operation.

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame()
        Called when the user wants to load a game. A confirmation message is displayed. Loads a game by calling the appropriate method of a DAO object. If there is no saved game, or the database is unreachable, an error message is shown. Requests view update.

      • handleSaveGameClicked

        public void handleSaveGameClicked()
        Called when the user wants to save the game. A confirmation message is shown. A new thread is started for the game saving operation.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame()
        Saves the current game by calling the appropriate method of a DAO object. If the database is unreachable, an error message is shown.

      • gameSaved

        public void gameSaved()
        Called when the game saving operation finished. The user receives a message.

      • setWindowCtr

        public void setWindowCtr(GameWindowController windowCtr)
        Sets the reference to the GameWindowController object which represents the view.
        Parameters:
        windowCtr - the windowCtr to set

      • setLoginController

        public void setLoginController(LoginWindowController loginCtr)
        Sets the reference to the LoginWindowController object, which represents the login window.
        Parameters:
        loginCtr - the loginCtr to set

      • setMenuBarController

        public void setMenuBarController(MenuBarController menuBarCtr)
        Sets the reference to the setMenuBarController object, which represents the menu bar.
        Parameters:
        menuBarCtr - the menuBarCtr to set

        Player getPlayer()

        Bag getBag()
